issue.title: Splitwise Clone v2
issue.body:
## Build expense-sharing app

A web app where friends track shared expenses and settle debts.

**Features:**
- Google OAuth + email/password login  
- Create expense groups, invite members
- Add expenses (split equally among members)
- Real-time balance calculations
- Settle up functionality
- Live updates with Socket.io

**Tech Stack:**
- Next.js 14 App Router
- Tailwind CSS + shadcn/ui
- Lucide React icons
- SQLite with better-sqlite3
- NextAuth.js
- Socket.io

**Design:**
- Clean, minimal - not generic AI look
- Mobile-first responsive
- Use shadcn/ui components

**Pages:**
- Landing page
- Login/Signup
- Dashboard (list groups, balances)
- Group detail (expenses, members, balances)
- Create group dialog

ems.task: Initialize Next.js 14 project with App Router, configure TypeScript, create .gitignore for Next.js, set up package.json with all dependencies (next-auth, better-sqlite3, socket.io, shadcn/ui, tailwindcss), configure tsconfig.json with strict mode, and set up Tailwind CSS configuration
ems.error: No workers merged - all had conflicts

ems.task: Design and implement SQLite database schema with better-sqlite3, including tables for users, groups, group_members, expenses, expense_splits, and settlements. Create database initialization and connection utilities. Implement all database access layer functions for CRUD operations
ems.error: No workers merged - all had conflicts

ems.task: Configure NextAuth.js for authentication with both Google OAuth provider and email/password credentials. Implement session management, API routes for login/signup/logout, and protected route middleware. Create user registration and profile management

workers.task: Set up NextAuth.js core configuration with Google OAuth and Credentials provider. Create authentication API routes in src/app/api/auth/[...nextauth]/route.ts. Create auth configuration file in src/lib/auth.ts with provider setup and session strategy. Install and configure NextAuth.js dependencies.

Create database schema and models for user authentication in src/db/schema.ts using better-sqlite3. Implement user CRUD operations in src/db/users.ts. Create password hashing utilities in src/lib/password.ts using bcrypt. Build registration API route in src/app/api/auth/register/route.ts for email/password signup.

Create middleware for protected routes in src/middleware.ts. Build authentication context provider in src/contexts/AuthContext.tsx. Create custom hooks for authentication state in src/hooks/useAuth.ts. Implement session utilities in src/lib/session.ts. Build profile management API routes in src/app/api/user/profile/route.ts (GET for fetching, PUT for updating).

ems.task: Implement group management functionality including creating groups, inviting members via email/invite codes, joining groups, and managing member roles. Build the balance calculation engine that tracks who owes whom. Create settlement logic for marking debts as paid

workers.task: Implement group management system - create src/lib/groups/ with group creation, member management, invite code generation, and role management functionality
Build balance calculation engine in src/lib/balances/ - track debts, calculate who owes whom, handle expense splitting logic
Create settlement system in src/lib/settlements/ - mark debts as paid, track payment history, handle partial settlements

ems.task: Build expense management features: add expenses with description, amount, payer, and split configuration. Implement equal split logic among group members. Create expense editing and deletion. Build expense history and filtering capabilities

workers.task: Create expense data models and SQLite database layer for expense CRUD operations with split configuration support
Implement expense API routes for creating, editing, deleting expenses and equal split calculation logic
Build expense UI components including add/edit forms, expense list with history, and filtering interface

ems.task: Implement Socket.io server for real-time updates. Create events for new expenses, group changes, member joins/leaves, and settlements. Build presence system for active users. Handle connection/disconnection and room management per group

workers.task: Create Socket.io server initialization and core infrastructure. Implement server singleton at server/socket-server.ts with Socket.io setup, HTTP server integration, and CORS configuration. Create socket event definitions at shared/socket-events.ts defining all event names for expenses, groups, members, settlements, and presence. Set up connection middleware at server/socket-middleware.ts for authentication and user context attachment.

Implement real-time event handlers for expenses and groups. Create expense handlers at server/handlers/expense-handlers.ts to broadcast new/updated/deleted expenses to group rooms. Create group handlers at server/handlers/group-handlers.ts for group changes, member joins/leaves, and room management. Implement presence system at server/handlers/presence-handlers.ts to track active users, handle connections/disconnections, and broadcast online user lists per group.

Create settlement event handlers and client-side Socket.io integration. Implement settlement handlers at server/handlers/settlement-handlers.ts to broadcast new settlements and balance updates. Create Socket.io client hook at hooks/useSocket.ts for managing socket connection, listening to events, and auto-reconnection. Build presence indicator component at components/presence-indicator.tsx to display online users in group view. Add socket connection provider at components/socket-provider.tsx to wrap the app and manage socket lifecycle.

ems.task: Build landing page with hero section and feature highlights. Create login and signup pages with forms for both OAuth and email/password. Implement form validation and error handling. Add responsive navigation and footer components

Implement dashboard page showing user's groups with net balance per group, total owed/owing summary, and quick actions to create groups or settle up. Build responsive grid layout for group cards with balance indicators and member avatars

Create group detail page with expense list, member list showing individual balances, add expense form, and settle up functionality. Build expense modal dialog with split configuration. Implement member management (invite/remove). Add activity feed for recent changes

Create reusable shadcn/ui components customized for the app: buttons, cards, dialogs, forms, tables, avatars, badges, and toast notifications. Implement consistent design tokens, color scheme, and typography. Add loading states and skeleton screens

Implement Socket.io client integration for real-time UI updates. Connect to dashboard, group detail pages for live expense/balance changes. Build optimistic UI updates for better perceived performance. Handle connection errors and reconnection logic

analysisSummary: Build a complete expense-sharing application with Next.js 14, featuring Google OAuth/email authentication, group expense management, real-time balance tracking, and Socket.io for live updates. The app will use SQLite for data storage, shadcn/ui for the UI, and implement a clean, mobile-first design.
